channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: The Nature of Natural Gas
item.description:
With months to go before peak U.S. consumption, natural gas has been surging in price. The rise comes on the heels of high summer temperatures in the northern hemisphere and shut-ins after hurricane Ida. Now, the focus is on the spread between March and April natural gas futures, which is a bet on how tight supplies will be at the end of the North American winter.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they discuss the recent volatility in natural gas and analyze the prospects of a volatile winter.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.content:encoded:
With months to go before peak U.S. consumption, natural gas has been surging in price. The rise comes on the heels of high summer temperatures in the northern hemisphere and shut-ins after hurricane Ida. Now, the focus is on the spread between March and April natural gas futures, which is a bet on how tight supplies will be at the end of the North American winter.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they discuss the recent volatility in natural gas and analyze the prospects of a volatile winter.

item.title: When To Roll
item.description:
Rolling is more an art than a definite science. Some traders prefer not to roll at all for simplicity while others want to have a stronger grip on their delta risk.

For those who want to have a starting benchmark for trade adjustment, consider rolling the untested side of a trade back to its starting delta when the delta of the tested side grows by 50%.

item.content:encoded:
Rolling is more an art than a definite science. Some traders prefer not to roll at all for simplicity while others want to have a stronger grip on their delta risk.

For those who want to have a starting benchmark for trade adjustment, consider rolling the untested side of a trade back to its starting delta when the delta of the tested side grows by 50%.

item.title: Expirations vs. Earnings
item.description: Earnings announcements make for excellent opportunities to sell premium, expecting volatility to come down afterwards. Monthly expiration dates can have similar effects on volatility. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how the volatility effects from expiration stack up against those from earnings.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.title: Friends of the 10-Year Yield
item.description:
After initially dropping in the wake of Wednesday’s FOMC rate decision, 10-year yields are decidedly higher in the past few trading sessions. The market seems to be pricing in a chance that the Fed will announce the tapering of its bond purchases in November. This could have an impact on certain sectors of the market.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they check to see which sectors are friendly to the move up in 10-year yields.

item.itunes:subtitle: After initially dropping in the wake of Wednesday’s FOMC rate decision, 10-year yields are decidedly higher in the past few trading sessions. The market seems to be pricing in a chance that the Fed will announce the tapering of its bond purchases ...
item.content:encoded:
After initially dropping in the wake of Wednesday’s FOMC rate decision, 10-year yields are decidedly higher in the past few trading sessions. The market seems to be pricing in a chance that the Fed will announce the tapering of its bond purchases in November. This could have an impact on certain sectors of the market.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they check to see which sectors are friendly to the move up in 10-year yields.

item.title: When to Trade a Jade Lizard
item.description:
The Jade Lizard is a strategy developed by Liz and Jenny at tastytrade that combines the best of two strategies. It's ideal for neutral price movements and high IVR, along with some cushy upside protection. 

A reverse jade lizard is set up as a short put spread and a short call which would be used for similar purposes with the directional assumption flipped, but beware of put skew when employing the reverse jade lizard.

The Jade Lizard is a strategy developed by Liz and Jenny at tastytrade that combines the best of two strategies. It's ideal for neutral price movements and high IVR, along with some cushy upside protection. 

A reverse jade lizard is set up as a short put spread and a short call which would be used for similar purposes with the directional assumption flipped, but beware of put skew when employing the reverse jade lizard.

item.title: Earnings Action
item.description: Earnings announcements provide tastytraders with ripe trading opportunities: not only do underlyings tend to move more around with earnings, but IV almost always comes down afterward. Today, TP and Tony look at the data to contrast underlying behavior around earnings with the behavior on an ordinary day.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Earnings announcements provide tastytraders with ripe trading opportunities: not only do underlyings tend to move more around with earnings, but IV almost always comes down afterward. Today, TP and Tony look at the data to contrast underlying beha...

item.title: Free Trade Ideas? Sign Me Up!
item.description:
Introducing Alpha Boost, the new trade idea subscription service from the Quiet Foundation. A simple sign up will provide 3 emails per week to your inbox of 5-to-10 option trade ideas that are generated from a proprietary trade hunting system. Best of all, it’s free!

Join Tom, TP and Jermal as they preview the new Alpha Boost service and check out the trade ideas it generates.

item.title: Are Quad Witching Days Special?
item.description: Despite popular speculation, quad witching days were statistically no different to random market days in terms of average moves, volatility, and price ranges. Although volume tends to increase on these days, there is no tradable edge to be taken advantage.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Despite popular speculation, quad witching days were statistically no different to random market days in terms of average moves, volatility, and price ranges. Although volume tends to increase on these days, there is no tradable edge to be taken a...

item.title: Volume and Volatility
item.description: tastytraders know that periods of high volatility are opportunities for selling premium. High volatility tends to go hand in hand with high trade volume. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see if paying attention to volume can give us any insight into upcoming volatility changes.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: tastytraders know that periods of high volatility are opportunities for selling premium. High volatility tends to go hand in hand with high trade volume. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see if paying attention to volume can give us any ins...

item.title: Placing Bets on the Volatility of Sports Betting
item.description:
The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led to added interest in the gambling and casino stock space. 

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they seek out opportunities to trade volatility in the sports betting industry.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led...

The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led to added interest in the gambling and casino stock space. 

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they seek out opportunities to trade volatility in the sports betting industry.

item.title: Trading Volatility ETFs Can Be a Drag
item.description:
The VIX is a measure of 30-day forward volatility in the S&P 500. In short, people trade VIX futures and options when they want to make bets on the rise or fall of overall market volatility. Volatility (Leveraged) ETFs offer another way do the same thing. They track VIX futures, therefore, in times of contango they tend to decay due to the subsequent roll from first to second month.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as break down the concept of volatility drag and the effect it has on volatility ETFs that track the VIX.

item.content:encoded:
The VIX is a measure of 30-day forward volatility in the S&P 500. In short, people trade VIX futures and options when they want to make bets on the rise or fall of overall market volatility. Volatility (Leveraged) ETFs offer another way do the same thing. They track VIX futures, therefore, in times of contango they tend to decay due to the subsequent roll from first to second month.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as break down the concept of volatility drag and the effect it has on volatility ETFs that track the VIX.
